titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Nationality Rooms Program Office Files, Second Deposit, 1927-2012 UA.40.01a
titlestmt.author: Bryan Brown.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:02:55 -0400.

did.unittitle: Nationality Rooms Program Office Files, Second Deposit

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. Nationality Rooms Program

did.abstract: These records represent the second deposit of office files created and collected by the Nationality Rooms Program.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the Nationality Rooms Program Office in December 2014.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The collection was housed in the Nationality Rooms Office until it was processed from October 2014 to January 2015. It was transferred to the University Archives after processing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection comprises the following series:

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The University of Pittsburgh's Nationality Rooms Program was developed by Chancellor Dr. John G. Bowman and Ruth Crawford Mitchell to engage the citizens in the Pittsburgh region. Following the completion of the Cathedral of Learning in 1926, Bowman and Mitchell aimed for unique classrooms that reflect the ethnic heritage of the people who settled Western Pennsylvania. As the rooms were being planned and constructed, there was a need to oversee these activities and to develop the policies under which they were to operate. After their rooms were built, the committees focused on raising funds for scholarships for University of Pittsburgh students. The Summer Study Abroad scholarships sponsored by the Nationality Rooms Committees reflect decades of work by those committees to honor an ideal--education through cultural exchange.
The Nationality Rooms Program Office continues to administer and oversee the scholarships, oversee the construction of new rooms and the ongoing maintenance of existing rooms.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Nationality Rooms Program Office Files, Second Deposit, 1927-2012, UA.40.01a, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Nationality Rooms Program Office Files, Second Deposit, 1927-2012, UA.40.01a, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of office files from the Nationality Rooms Program. Included are reports, policies, correspondence, related organizations, newsletters, and other materials relating to the day to day operation of the office. It also includes the documents that are created by the administration of the Study Abroad Scholarships.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The initial arrangement plan and first series processing was completed by Emily Reed in August 2014. The final arrangement plan for the collection was completed by Bryan Brown in October-November 2014.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Nationality Rooms Program Office Files, Initial Deposit, UA.40.01, 1926-1966, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

University of Pittsburgh
controlaccess.corpname: Nationality Rooms (Cathedral of Learning, Pittsburgh, Pa.)
University of Pittsburgh. Nationality Rooms Program
University of Pittsburgh. Nationality Rooms Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of office files from the Nationality Rooms Program. Included are reports, policies, correspondence, related organizations, newsletters, and other materials relating to the day to day operation of the office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Staff meetings, annual reports, financial reports, and projections of the rooms from 1927 until the G-20 Summit in 2009. Documents in this subseries also include the University of Pittsburgh's history and description of each individual Nationality Room.

did.unittitle: Complete Cost of Finished Nationality Rooms
P.I.P. Info Area – Room & V.C. Settlement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection of the policies and procedures implemented in the Nationality Rooms throughout the years that enabled the program to flourish. Sample policies and procedures include: fundraising, deed of gift procedure, and the architectural guidelines for the rooms.

did.unittitle: Standing Rules and Function of RMS
Deed of Gift Procedure and Samples

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries has the different types of correspondence throughout the Nationality Rooms' office and committees. The types of correspondence include: use of the room, inquiries, new room inquiries, complaints, and in-office memos to name a few.

did.unittitle: Office of Urban and Community Services
PA Federation of Museums and Historical Organizations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the documents pertaining to the physical maintenance and management of the facilities. This includes the individual Nationality Rooms and the Cathedral of Learning in general.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A subseries of documents in regards to facilities which are administered by the Nationality Rooms Program.

did.unittitle: 12th Floor Cathedral of Learning History and Policies
12th Floor Cathedral of Learning History and Policies
Facilities with Historical Significance within the University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries focuses on the facilities that are not officially affiliated with the Nationality Rooms Program, but are administrated by the University of Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries looks at the other programs similar to the University of Pittsburgh's Nationality Rooms. Focus is placed upon Cleveland Ethnic Rooms, Wayne State University, sister-city Scheffield, and Nationality Rooms elsewhere in the 1990's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection of the newsletters sent out by the Nationality Rooms Office regarding the rooms. Topics range from Room history, scholarships, publicity, and events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is a collection that focuses on the websites created by the Nationality Rooms Office or the Rooms individually. Documents include memos, printed screenshots, and emails.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries has some of the architectural drawings and sketches for the Nationality Rooms as well as other rooms under the direction of the Nationality Rooms Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains architectural drawings and sketches for the following rooms: Croghan-Schenley, Welsh, Romanian, Hungarian, Scottish, Yugoslav, Swedish, Chinese, Czechoslovak, Norwegian, Polish, Italian, English, French, German, Russian, Syria-Lebanon and Armenian Rooms. Also several drawings for room 124 Cathedral (Executive Offices).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Contains architectural drawings and sketches for the Ukranian and Armenian Classrooms and 3 copies of the Bowman Calligraphy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection of files with topics that were of interests to the Director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection of the scholarships given out by the Nationality Rooms and Intercultural Exchange Program throughout the years. Reports by students who received the scholarships and who the scholarships are in honor of is also within this collection. This series also contains photographic materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries focuses on the reports given by the scholarship winners, Nationality Rooms and Intercultural Exchange Program. Correspondence, progress reports, finished reports, and photographic materials make up the bulk of this collection.

did.unittitle: Organization for the Foreign Visitor and Student in Pittsburgh, Pa., U.S.A
Helen Pool Rush Grant – Rachel E. Kloock
Africa Room Nationality Scholarship Award – Rebecca Stroup (Rwanguba)
Nationality Rooms Committee and Women's International Club – Heather H. Kiraly
Eugene Manasterski Memorial Ukrainian Room Research Grant – Kumen R. Call
Abigail Chua, Medical Research in Philippines Poster
Ruth Crawford Mitchell Memorial Award – Adrienne R. Washington (Caribbean nations)
Center for Latin American Studies Field Trip – Monica Faust (Brazil)
Elanore K. Shenesky – Fred Schaefer Memorial Scholarship
Carolyn J.P. Shaw – Stanton C. Crawford Scholarship
Beverly Reifman – Frederic Schaefer Memorial Scholarship
Susan E. Scott – French Committee Scholarship 1965
Marcia H. Getting – Vira Heinz Award

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection regarding the scholarships given out by the Nationality Rooms and the Office of Cultural Education Exchange. This collection also focuses on those whose names are honored by the scholarships. News clippings, photographic materials, published materials for publicity, correspondence, and obituaries of those involved are the types of documents that make up the bulk of this collection.

did.unittitle: Sir William Radcliffe Award and Biography Information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents, photographs, and other materials that reflect the various events that took place at, or were related to, the Nationality Rooms. Types of events include: a Christmas and Holiday Open House, Nationality Room dedications, foreign ambassador visits, the celebration of the United States of America's Bicentennial, and more.

did.unittitle: Bicentennial of the United States of America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents the city of Pittsburgh's celebration of the Bicentennial of the United States of America. Included are correspondence and meeting minutes regarding the celebrations, as well as a history of the Cathedral of Learning.

did.unittitle: Presentation of History of Cathedral of Learning Given by E.M. Bruhns

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is devoted to the various visitors that the University of Pittsburgh has welcomed, most of which toured the Nationality Rooms during their stay. VIPs include ambassadors from Greece, the United Nations, and Norway; the Swedish Consul; Polish Head of State; and Lord Mayor of Sheffield.

did.unittitle: Cameroon Visitor, African Heritage Classroom Committee
American Society of Interior Designers Tour
People's Republic of China, Minister of Metallurgic Industries
Japanese Room, Osaka Chamber Of Commerce
Visit of Polish Head of State

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents anniversaries celebrated by the Nationality Rooms and Cathedral of Learning, primarily through correspondence, photographs, and event programs.

did.unittitle: Nationality Rooms 80th Anniversary, Thank You Comments and Photo CD
Nationality Rooms Program 80th Anniversary Hillman Library Exhibit
Nationality Rooms and Intercultural Exchange Programs 80th Anniversary Celebration
Nationality Rooms 80th Anniversary Program, Proclamation and Dance Groups
Women's International Club 50th Anniversary, Winners Questionnaire

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is a collection of materials that relate to the Holiday and Open House Events that took place within the Cathedral of Learning and Nationality Rooms. Files include correspondence, promotional materials, publicity, photographs, requests for rooms, floor plans for the events, programs, event time slots, and committee lists.

did.unittitle: News Releases: Yearly Christmas Open House
Open House, Decorating, and Undecorating Day

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is comprised of committee member lists for each of the Nationality Rooms, which often include member names and contact information. There is also some correspondence regarding committee member changes.

did.unittitle: Scandinavian Society in Western Pennsylvania Membership List

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence, photographs, and publicity materials for a variety of one-time events that took place at the Cathedral of Learning, Nationality Rooms, or at institutions related in some fashion to the Nationality Rooms. Classroom dedications, classroom materials auction, presentation guides, exhibits, and other events are represented.

did.unittitle: Slide Presentation: Script, Care of, How to give
Ethnic Arts Project, Kent State University
Robert Morris College and International Newsletter
David L. Lawrence Hall Floor Plan and Dedication

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains publicity materials regarding the Nationality Rooms, Cathedral of Learning, University of Pittsburgh, and City of Pittsburgh. Materials include local, national and international newspapers, newsletters, pamphlets, books, magazines, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is a collection of the newsletters published and distributed by the Nationality Rooms program. A Nationality Room was highlighted for each publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents publicity regarding the Cathedral of Learning. Information concerning the building's funding, construction, completion, room dedications, ghost stories, and publications regarding the Cathedral of Learning and Nationality Rooms compose this subseries.

did.unittitle: Secrets of the Cathedral of Learning
Presentation of the Scottish, German, Swedish, and Russian Rooms

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains general publicity regarding the Nationality Rooms and the City of Pittsburgh. Correspondence for one-time events; news stories from local, national, and international sources; magazines; and room dedications are found within this subseries.
